content.title: Andaman & Nicobar Islands Scheme for Health Insurance
content.department: Health Department, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
content.beneficiary: Below Poverty Level individuals, Pensioners of A&N Administration, Permanent Residents with annual income below ₹3.00 Lakhs
content.details: The scheme provides cashless medical treatment benefit up to ₹5.00 Lakhs per patient per illness to eligible individuals. It aims to assist economically disadvantaged patients who cannot afford hospital expenses.
benefits: Cashless treatment up to ₹5 Lakhs per patient per illness including indoor and outdoor treatments.
Free travel expenses for patients with one attendant (Bunk class fare).
Reimbursement of air ticket for critically ill patients and one attendant if referred to travel by flight.
Emergency treatment benefits available for patients who fall sick during personal visits to the mainland.
eligibility: Individuals belonging to the BPL category settled in the A&N Islands.
Government pensioners of the A&N Administration settled in these Islands after retirement with dependent family members.
Permanent residents of the Andaman & Nicobar Islands with a family annual income below ₹3.00 Lakhs.
exclusions: Reimbursement of hospital expenses will not be allowed if treatment is undergone without completing codal formalities at the State Nodal Cell (ANISHI).
content.application_process: Offline. Eligible patients must complete codal formalities at the Nodal Cell (ANISHI) and be referred by a specialist at GB Pant Hospital, Port Blair.
documents_required: BPL Patient: Islander Card/Voter ID Card, BPL Ration Card
Pensioners: Pension Payment Order, Ration Card, Islander Card/Voter ID Card
Permanent Resident Category Patients: Islander Card/Voter ID Card, Ration Card

faqs.question: What is ANISHI?
faqs.answer: ANISHI stands for Andaman & Nicobar Islands Scheme for Health Insurance, launched on January 26, 2015.

faqs.question: Who can avail benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals belonging to BPL, Government pensioners of A&N Administration, and permanent residents with a family annual income below ₹3.00 Lakhs.

faqs.question: What are the benefits offered by the scheme?
faqs.answer: Cashless medical treatment up to ₹5 Lakhs per patient per illness, including travel expenses for patients and one attendant.

faqs.question: Can patients avail treatment outside of the Andaman & Nicobar Islands under the scheme?
What if a beneficiary falls sick during a personal visit to the mainland?
faqs.answer: They can avail benefits for emergency treatment, but travel expenses will not be reimbursed.
